column4: EvilDaemon: to determine the dependencies it's easier to do "apt-cache depends <package>
I don't have internet on my ubuntu pc, I only have internet on windows.
Could you run Ubuntu in a VM on Windows?
How about booting to the Live CD?
yes. But I don't want compizconfig-settings manager installed on live cd, but on my ubuntu pc
is there some windows program like "download all .deb needed to install package xy"? Then I could copy them on a usb drive and to ubuntu pc
If you had Ubuntu running you can also download all the required packages without installing them using "apt-get --download-only install <package>"
Hmmm, sounds like you need someone else to get the list of packages for you
what package do you want to install? and what version of Ubuntu is on the other PC?
yes, that would work. (I can run a live cd on a computer that is in the internet).

On the Ubuntu PC, can you run this command to see what it *thinks* it needs? "sudo apt-get -d --reinstall install compizconfig-settings-manager" - this will tell you precisely which packages it needs to fetch, as opposed to what it has
and then I have to download those package .deb? ok.
I think you will only need CCSM and python-compizconfig
